# Find the ones with year 2005 or earlier
for ref_id, text in refs:
    years = re.findall(r'\b(19\d{2}|200[0-9])\b', text)
    if years:
        print(f"{ref_id}: {min(years)} - {text[:100]}")

tools.result:
=== OLDEST REFERENCE DETAILS ===
ID: cite_note-38
Title: 'Basel II Comprehensive version part 2: The First Pillar – Minimum Capital Requirements'
Authors: Basel Committee on Banking Supervision (no individual authors listed)
Publisher: Bank for International Settlements
Date: November 2005
URL: https://www.bis.org/publ/bcbs128b.pdf
URL Status: LIVE (HTTP 200)

=== INLINE CLAIM ===
'Advocates a change in the accounting standards towards an expected loss (EL) approach (usually, EL amount := LGD*PD*EAD).[38]'

=== ACCURACY ASSESSMENT ===
The reference is the Basel II comprehensive document from 2005.
The claim says Basel III 'advocates a change in the accounting standards towards an expected loss (EL) approach'.
The cited document (Basel II) contains the formula EL = LGD*PD*EAD (p.86).
However, this is a Basel II document, used to support a Basel III article's claim about EL approach.
The claim is about advocating for a change, and the Basel II doc defines expected loss - this is a relevant reference.
The citation is partially accurate - the formula EL=LGD*PD*EAD is from Basel II, not Basel III,
but the reference supports the mathematical definition of EL being used in the claim.
